intro: Willoughbya andrachne, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. The botanical features of Willoughbya andrachne make it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
